metadata.titleEn: Temperature and precipitation data at meteorological stations in five Central Asian countries (1980-2015)
metadata.titleCn: 中亚五国气象站点气温和降水数据（1980-2015）
metadata.description:
The data set covers 599 meteorological stations in five Central Asian countries, including the following elements: * daily maximum temperature, * daily minimum temperature, * observed temperature, * Precipitation (i.e. rain, melting snow), covering the following dates: 1980-1986; 1996-2005; 2010; 2014; 2015
The data comes from ghcn-d, a data set containing global land area daily observation data, which integrates climate records.
The data is a direct measurement of surface temperature, without interpolation or model assumptions, and contains many long-term site records. The disadvantage is uneven space coverage. Due to changes in observation time, site location, and the type of thermometer used, the records contain many heterogeneity.
For more information about this dataset, see https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/ghcnd-data-access
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集为中亚五国599个气象站点的气温和降水数据包括以下要素：*每日最高温度、*每日最低温度、*观察时的温度、*降水（即下雨，融化的雪），涵盖日期包括：1980年-1986年；1996年-2005年；2010年；2014年；2015年
数据来源于GHCN-D-一个包含全球陆地区域日观测数据的数据集，GHCN-Daily综合了气候记录。
数据为直接测量表面温度，无需插值或模型假设，包含许多长期的站点记录。缺点是空间覆盖不均，由于观察时间，站点位置和使用的温度计类型的变化，记录包含许多不均匀性。
有关此数据集的详细信息，可参考https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/ghcnd-data-access
metadata.instructions:
The following information serves as a definition of each field in one line of data covering one station-day. Each field described below is separated by a comma ( , ) and follows the order
presented in this document.

ID = 11 character station identification code
YEAR/MONTH/DAY = 8 character date in YYYYMMDD format (e.g. 19860529 = May 29, 1986)
ELEMENT = 4 character indicator of element type 
DATA VALUE = 5 character data value for ELEMENT 
M-FLAG = 1 character Measurement Flag 
Q-FLAG = 1 character Quality Flag 
S-FLAG = 1 character Source Flag 
OBS-TIME = 4-character time of observation in hour-minute format (i.e. 0700 =7:00 am)

For more information on this data set, please visit the GHCN Daily Website http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/oa/climate/ghcn-daily/

background: The analysis of multidecadal climate trends and variability is commonly based on monthly and annual summaries of station-based weather data, and records of this time resolution have been widely available in digital form for decades (e.g., Jones et al. 1985, 1986; Vose et al. 1992). However, monthly means and averages are not sufficient for all climate applications. For example, the analysis of changes in the length of the growing season (Kunkel et al. 2004), changes in the frequency of heavy precipitation (Min et al. 2011), and changes in heat wave frequency and duration (Della Marta et al. 2007) all require data at least at the daily resolution. Unfortunately, daily data are comparatively less accessible than monthly values, in part because of impediments (e.g., mandates for cost recovery) in many countries for releasing daily climate data for widespread public use (Alexander et al. 2006). This relative paucity of daily data hampers climate change analysis and model comparison studies (Trenberth et al. 2007).
research objective: Here, a database is described whose aim is to address the need for daily climate data over global land areas.
methods: In addition, two checks have been manually performed to identify stations with grossly incorrect coordinates: 1) a comparison of each station’s elevation to the Global One-Kilometer Base Elevation (GLOBE) dataset (Globe Task Team et al. 1999) and 2) a comparison of the long-term monthly station averages of maximum temperature, minimum temperature, and total precipitation to an independently constructed gridded dataset of monthly values (Legates and Willmott 1990a,b). A semiautomatic method for identifying large jumps and other erratic behavior in time series of annual totals was also applied. Gross shifts in precipitation time series were identified by means of the standard normal homogeneity test (Alexandersson 1986) applied to station time series of annual precipitation totals computed from the daily data. A manual examination of station records where maximum and minimum temperatures failed the outlier and/or inconsistency checks at least 300 times revealed two problems. In the last record integrity check, U.S. temperature records for which the time of observation has been documented are tested for inconsistencies between the reported observation time and the reported temperatures.
dataset: The dataset, known as Global Historical Climatology Network (GHCN)-Daily, was developed for a wide variety of potential applications, including climate analysis and monitoring studies that require data at a daily time resolution (e.g., assessments of the frequency of heavy rainfall, heat wave duration, etc.). The dataset contains records from over 80 000 stations in 180 countries and territories, and its processing system produces the official archive for U.S. daily data. Variables commonly include maximum and minimum temperature, total daily precipitation, snowfall, and snow depth; however, about two-thirds of the stations report precipitation only.
backgroundCn: 多年代际气候趋势和变异性的分析通常基于基于站点的天气数据的月度和年度汇总，而这种时间分辨率的记录在数字形式上已经广泛可用数十年（例如，Jones等，1985，1986；Vose等，1992）。然而，月均值和平均值并不足以满足所有气候应用的需求。例如，生长季节长度变化的分析（Kunkel等，2004）、强降水频率变化的分析（Min等，2011）以及热浪频率和持续时间变化的分析（Della Marta等，2007）都至少需要日分辨率的数据。不幸的是，与月度值相比，日数据的获取相对较少，部分原因是许多国家在发布日气候数据供公众广泛使用时存在障碍（例如，成本回收的要求）（Alexander等，2006）。这种日数据的相对匮乏妨碍了气候变化分析和模型比较研究（Trenberth等，2007）。
research objectiveCn: 这里描述了一个数据库，其目的是满足全球陆地区域每日气候数据的需求。
methodsCn: 此外，已经手动执行了两项检查，以识别坐标明显不正确的气象站：1）将每个气象站的海拔与全球一公里基础海拔（GLOBE）数据集（Globe Task Team et al. 1999）进行比较；2）将长期月度气象站的最高气温、最低气温和总降水量的平均值与独立构建的月度值网格数据集进行比较（Legates and Willmott 1990a,b）。还应用了一种半自动方法来识别年度总量时间序列中的大幅跳跃和其他异常行为。通过对从日数据计算的年度降水总量的气象站时间序列应用标准正态同质性检验（Alexandersson 1986），识别降水时间序列中的明显变化。对在300次以上的异常值和/或不一致性检查中失败的最大和最小气温记录进行了手动检查，发现了两个问题。在最后一次记录完整性检查中，已记录观察时间的美国气温记录被测试，以检查报告的观察时间与报告的温度之间的一致性。
datasetCn: 全球历史气候网络（GHCN）-每日数据集旨在用于多种潜在应用，包括需要每日时间分辨率的数据的气候分析和监测研究（例如，强降雨频率评估、热浪持续时间等）。该数据集包含来自180个国家和地区的超过80,000个气象站的记录，其处理系统生成美国每日数据的官方档案。常见的变量包括最高和最低气温、每日总降水量、降雪量和雪深；然而，大约三分之二的气象站仅报告降水量。

background: One of the most active areas of climatological research is the study of changes in the frequency and intensity of extreme events. In the past, limitations in data availability and computational resources have frequently restricted such studies to particular countries, regions, or individual locations. Thanks to technological advances as well as a greater willingness of countries to share their daily observations, it has become possible to assemble and regularly update a global dataset of historical daily meteorological observations. GHCN-Daily consists of more than 1,500,000,000 observations at over 40,000 land-based stations, some of which date back to the mid-1800s. With this diversity of data comes a large variety of measurement, recording, digitization, transmission, and processing problems. Consequently, procedures that can ensure high-quality historical and real-time daily data are critical.
research objective: This paper describes a comprehensive set of fully automated quality assurance (QA) procedures for observations of daily surface temperature, precipitation, snowfall, and snow depth. The QA procedures are being applied operationally to the Global Historical Climatology Network (GHCN)-Daily dataset. The system consists of 19 carefully evaluated tests that detect duplicate data, climatological outliers, and various inconsistencies (internal, temporal, and spatial).
challenges: Although effective, the semiautomatic approach is impractical for datasets as large as GHCN-Daily, which must be reprocessed regularly to incorporate additional historical and real-time data. Therefore, the challenge is to design a QA system that, without manual intervention, is effective at detecting a variety of data errors and that has a low false-positive rate, or fraction of flagged values that are false positives. Unfortunately, the electronic data files do not include an indication of whether the reported value is due to snow, hail, or another form of frozen precipitation, often making it virtually impossible for either data users or QA procedures to distinguish reports of hail from the at least equally frequent, erroneous, warm-season nonzero values in the SNOW and SNWD fields.
methods: Manual review of random samples of the values flagged as errors is used to set the threshold for each procedure such that its false-positive rate, or fraction of valid values identified as errors, is minimized. In addition, the tests are arranged in a deliberate sequence in which the performance of the later checks is enhanced by the error detection capabilities of the earlier tests. The QA of daily surface observations is frequently performed in a semiautomatic fashion in which trained validators examine a subset of values flagged by the automatic procedures and override the system’s decision whenever they deem a flagged value to be valid. The GHCN-Daily QA system consists of procedures that test for all of the above-mentioned types of data errors. Many of these are replicates or extensions of checks employed by others, while others, such as the frequent-value and megaconsistency checks, utilize concepts that have received little or no attention in the peer-reviewed literature. Each individual check in the GHCN-Daily QA system is required to have a false-positive rate of no more than 20%. To ensure adherence to this requirement, each test is applied in a preliminary fashion to the entire GHCN-Daily dataset. Random samples of flagged values are then manually inspected for a range of plausible test thresholds, and the fraction of false positives in each sample is determined. The tests in the GHCN-Daily system can be grouped into five general categories that are executed in the following order: basic integrity checks, outlier tests, internal and temporal consistency checks, spatial consistency checks, and “megaconsistency” checks.
dataset: The QA procedures are being applied operationally to the Global Historical Climatology Network (GHCN)-Daily dataset. GHCN-Daily consists of more than 1,500,000,000 observations at over 40,000 land-based stations, some of which date back to the mid-1800s. The primary meteorological elements represented include daily maximum and minimum temperature (TMAX and TMIN), 24-h precipitation (PRCP) and snowfall (SNOW) totals, and the snow depth at a certain time of day (SNWD).
findings: Based on an assessment of each individual check and a final evaluation for each element, the system identifies 3.6 million (0.24%) of the more than 1.5 billion maximum/minimum temperature, precipitation, snowfall, and snow depth values in GHCN-Daily as errors, has a false-positive rate of 1%22%, and is effective at detecting both the grossest errors as well as more subtle inconsistencies among elements.
backgroundCn: 气候学研究中最活跃的领域之一是极端事件频率和强度变化的研究。过去，由于数据可用性和计算资源的限制，这类研究通常仅限于特定国家、地区或个别地点。得益于技术进步以及各国更愿意分享其每日观测数据，现在可以汇编并定期更新全球历史每日气象观测数据集。GHCN-Daily包含超过15亿条观测数据，来自4万多个陆地气象站，其中一些数据可以追溯到19世纪中叶。由于数据的多样性，存在各种测量、记录、数字化、传输和处理问题。因此，确保高质量历史和实时每日数据的程序至关重要。
research objectiveCn: 本文描述了一套全面的全自动质量保证（QA）程序，用于日常地表温度、降水、降雪和雪深的观测数据。这些QA程序正在全球历史气候网络（GHCN）日常数据集上进行操作性应用。该系统由19个经过仔细评估的测试组成，能够检测重复数据、气候异常值以及各种不一致性（内部、不同时期和空间）。
challengesCn: 尽管半自动方法有效，但对于像GHCN-Daily这样的大型数据集来说，它是不切实际的，因为这些数据集必须定期重新处理，以纳入额外的历史和实时数据。因此，挑战在于设计一个质量保证系统，该系统在没有人工干预的情况下，能够有效检测各种数据错误，并且具有较低的误报率，即被标记为错误的值的比例。不幸的是，电子数据文件并未包含报告值是否由于雪、冰雹或其他形式的冻雨的指示，这使得数据用户或质量保证程序几乎不可能区分冰雹报告与在SNOW和SNWD字段中同样频繁出现的错误的温暖季节非零值。
methodsCn: 随机抽样的手动审核被用来设定每个程序的阈值，以最小化其假阳性率，即将有效值错误标记为错误的比例。此外，这些测试按照特定的顺序排列，后续检查的性能通过前面检查的错误检测能力得以增强。每日地面观测的质量控制通常以半自动的方式进行，经过培训的验证者检查自动程序标记的一部分值，并在他们认为标记的值有效时覆盖系统的决定。GHCN-Daily质量控制系统包含测试上述所有类型数据错误的程序。许多这些程序是其他人使用的检查的复制或扩展，而其他程序，如频繁值检查和“巨型一致性”检查，利用了在同行评审文献中很少或没有受到关注的概念。GHCN-Daily质量控制系统中的每个单独检查要求假阳性率不超过20%。为了确保遵守这一要求，每个测试首先在整个GHCN-Daily数据集上进行初步应用。然后随机抽样标记的值，手动检查一系列合理的测试阈值，并确定每个样本中的假阳性比例。GHCN-Daily系统中的测试可以分为五个一般类别，按以下顺序执行：基本完整性检查、异常值测试、内部和时间一致性检查、空间一致性检查以及“巨型一致性”检查。
datasetCn: QA程序正在对全球历史气候网络（GHCN）日常数据集进行操作性应用。GHCN-Daily包含超过15亿条观测数据，来自超过40,000个陆地气象站，其中一些数据可以追溯到19世纪中叶。主要的气象元素包括每日最高和最低气温（TMAX和TMIN）、24小时降水量（PRCP）和降雪（SNOW）总量，以及某一时刻的雪深（SNWD）。
findingsCn: 根据对每个单独检查的评估以及对每个元素的最终评估，该系统识别出360万个（0.24%）在GHCN-Daily中超过15亿个最大/最小温度、降水量、降雪量和雪深值中的错误，假阳性率为1%至22%，并且在检测最明显的错误以及元素之间更微妙的不一致性方面都很有效。

In practice, the transmission of daily climate summaries has been treated as optional even for the network of stations that report temperature, precipitation, surface pressure, etc., at fixed synoptic hours. Similarly, stations in the WMO’s Regional Basic Climate Network are only required to provide a monthly climate summary known as CLIMAT and likewise do not consistently transmit daily summaries within their synoptic messages.

research objectiveCn: 这里描述了一个数据库，其目的是满足全球陆地区域每日气候数据的需求。
challengesCn: 然而，目前没有正式的机制或要求通过全球气象系统（GTS）共享每日数据，也没有来自国家地面气象网络的每日气候报告的中央存储库。实际上，每日气候摘要的传输被视为可选，即使对于在固定的天气观测时间报告温度、降水、地面气压等的站点也是如此。同样，世界气象组织（WMO）的区域基本气候网络中的站点仅要求提供一个称为CLIMAT的月度气候摘要，也并不一致地在其天气观测信息中传输每日摘要。
methodsCn: 此外，还进行了两项手动检查，以识别坐标明显不正确的气象站：1）将每个气象站的海拔与全球一公里基础海拔（GLOBE）数据集（Globe Task Team et al. 1999）进行比较；2）将长期月度气象站的最高气温、最低气温和总降水量的平均值与独立构建的月度值网格数据集进行比较（Legates and Willmott 1990a,b）。还应用了一种半自动方法来识别年度总量时间序列中的大幅跳跃和其他异常行为。
datasetCn: 全球历史气候网络（GHCN）-每日数据集旨在用于多种潜在应用，包括需要每日时间分辨率的气候分析和监测研究。该数据集包含来自180个国家和地区的超过80,000个气象站的记录，其处理系统生成美国每日数据的官方档案。常见的变量包括最高和最低气温、每日总降水量、降雪量和雪深；然而，大约三分之二的气象站仅报告降水量。国际收集的数据包含来自美国以外约20,000个地点的历史记录（来自100多个不同国家），并在很大程度上反映了GDCN的数据收集工作。该集合中包含超过2亿个最高和最低气温及每日总降水量的值。

Verification.QuestionEn: Are quality assurance procedures necessary for managing daily meteorological observations?
Verification.QuestionCn: 质量保证程序对于管理日常气象观测是否必要？

Verification.QuestionEn: Is there a global dataset that collects daily meteorological data from over 80,000 stations in 180 countries?
Verification.QuestionCn: 是否有一个全球数据集收集来自180个国家的超过80,000个气象站的每日气象数据？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Which is the more common method for quality assurance in meteorological datasets: semiautomatic review by trained validators or fully automated quality assurance procedures?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在气象数据集的质量保证中，半自动审核由经过培训的验证者进行的方法更为常见，还是完全自动化的质量保证程序？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: What is the primary challenge in sharing daily climate data: inadequate formal mechanisms for data sharing, lack of central repositories, or both?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 共享每日气候数据的主要挑战是缺乏正式的数据共享机制、缺乏中央存储库，还是两者都有？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What are common variables included in a dataset for analyzing climate trends at a daily resolution?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在分析每日气候趋势的数据集中，常见的变量有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: daily maximum and minimum temperature, total daily precipitation, snowfall, snow depth
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 每日最高和最低气温、每日总降水量、降雪量、积雪深度

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where do challenges arise in the collection and sharing of daily climate data?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在收集和共享每日气候数据的过程中，挑战出现在哪里？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What quality assurance procedures are applied to ensure high-quality daily climate data?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 为了确保高质量的日常气候数据，应用了哪些质量保证程序？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to ensure the accuracy of meteorological station data in Central Asia for temperatures and precipitation?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个数据收集方法的例子，以确保中亚气象站温度和降水数据的准确性？
Example.AnswerEn: One example of a data collection method involves manually performing checks to identify stations with incorrect coordinates by comparing each station’s elevation to the Global One-Kilometer Base Elevation (GLOBE) dataset and comparing long-term monthly station averages of maximum temperature, minimum temperature, and total precipitation to an independently constructed gridded dataset of monthly values.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种数据收集方法涉及手动检查，以通过将每个站点的海拔与全球一公里基础海拔（GLOBE）数据集进行比较，来识别坐标不正确的站点，并将长期每月的最高气温、最低气温和总降水量的站点平均值与独立构建的每月值的网格数据集进行比较。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in collecting daily climate data for multidecadal climate trend analysis?
Example.QuestionCn: 在收集用于多年代气候趋势分析的每日气候数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge is that daily data are comparatively less accessible than monthly values due to impediments like mandates for cost recovery in many countries, which hampers climate change analysis and model comparison studies.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个挑战是，由于许多国家对成本回收的要求，日常数据相比于月度数据的可获取性较低，这妨碍了气候变化分析和模型比较研究。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that is used for global daily climate data analysis, including its scope and some of the meteorological elements it covers?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于全球日常气候数据分析的数据集示例，包括其范围和涵盖的一些气象要素？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset is the Global Historical Climatology Network (GHCN)-Daily, which consists of records from over 80,000 stations in 180 countries and territories. It includes variables like maximum and minimum temperature, total daily precipitation, snowfall, and snow depth, with about two-thirds of the stations reporting precipitation only.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子是全球历史气候网络（GHCN）-每日数据集，它包含来自180个国家和地区的超过80,000个气象站的记录。该数据集包括最大和最小温度、每日总降水量、降雪量和雪深等变量，其中约三分之二的气象站仅报告降水量。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What characteristics define the quality assurance procedures for large-scale meteorological datasets?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 大型气象数据集的质量保证程序的特征包括哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: comprehensive automated tests, detection of duplicate data, detection of climatological outliers, detection of inconsistencies, low false-positive rate, manual review of random samples, appropriate thresholds for error detection
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 全面的自动化测试，重复数据检测，气候异常值检测，不一致性检测，低误报率，随机样本的人工审核，适当的错误检测阈值。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many observations are included in a global climatology dataset?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 全球气候学数据集中包含多少个观测值？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the number of countries and territories providing data to a climatology network?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 提供数据给气候学网络的国家和地区数量是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many stations are involved in collecting temperature and precipitation data in the five Central Asian countries?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在五个中亚国家中，有多少个站点参与收集温度和降水数据？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'spatial consistency checks' in meteorological data quality assurance?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在气象数据质量保证中，“空间一致性检查”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: In meteorological data quality assurance, 'spatial consistency checks' refer to procedures that compare data from a specific station with data from nearby stations to identify discrepancies that may indicate errors. These checks help ensure that the reported data are consistent with the spatial patterns expected based on the geographic and climatic context.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在气象数据质量保证中，“空间一致性检查”是指将特定站点的数据与附近站点的数据进行比较，以识别可能表明错误的差异。这些检查有助于确保报告的数据与基于地理和气候背景的空间模式一致。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data accessibility and challenges between daily climate data and monthly climate summaries in global meteorological datasets?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 全球气象数据集中，日常气候数据和月度气候摘要在数据可获取性和挑战方面有什么区别？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Daily climate data are less accessible due to impediments like cost recovery mandates and lack of a central repository, which hampers climate change analysis. Monthly summaries are more widely available but insufficient for applications requiring daily resolution. Challenges include the lack of formal mechanisms for sharing daily data and the optional transmission of daily summaries.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 每日气候数据由于成本回收要求和缺乏中央存储库等障碍而变得不易获取，这妨碍了气候变化分析。每月总结数据更为广泛可用，但对于需要每日分辨率的应用来说仍然不够。挑战包括缺乏正式的每日数据共享机制以及每日总结的可选传输。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges can be inferred from the varying methods used to ensure data quality in global meteorological observations?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从确保全球气象观测数据质量的不同方法中，可以推断出哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges inferred from the methods used to ensure data quality in global meteorological observations include designing a quality assurance system that effectively detects a variety of data errors without manual intervention, while maintaining a low false-positive rate. Additionally, there are complexities in distinguishing between different types of precipitation, such as snow and hail, which can complicate data accuracy and quality assurance processes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 从全球气象观测中确保数据质量的方法中推断出的挑战包括设计一个质量保证系统，该系统能够有效地检测各种数据错误而无需人工干预，同时保持较低的误报率。此外，区分不同类型的降水，如雪和冰雹的复杂性，也可能使数据的准确性和质量保证过程变得复杂。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the observed inconsistencies in temperature and precipitation records influence the interpretation of climate trends over multiple decades?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 观察到的温度和降水记录中的不一致性可能会如何影响对多个十年气候趋势的解读？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Observed inconsistencies in temperature and precipitation records could significantly influence the interpretation of climate trends over multiple decades by introducing errors that may obscure true climate signals. These inconsistencies can arise from changes in observation times, station locations, or equipment, and thus require careful quality assurance and data homogenization methods to ensure accurate trend analysis.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 观察到的温度和降水记录的不一致性可能会显著影响对多个十年气候趋势的解读，因为这些不一致性可能引入错误，从而掩盖真实的气候信号。这些不一致性可能源于观测时间、站点位置或设备的变化，因此需要仔细的质量保证和数据同质化方法，以确保准确的趋势分析。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can be inferred about the potential limitations of using monthly and annual climate data for detailed climate applications, compared to daily data?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 与每日数据相比，使用月度和年度气候数据进行详细气候应用的潜在局限性是什么？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The potential limitations of using monthly and annual climate data for detailed climate applications, as inferred from the data, include a lack of resolution necessary for analyzing specific climate phenomena such as changes in the frequency of extreme weather events, the length of the growing season, and heat wave duration. Daily data provide a finer temporal resolution that is essential for these types of analyses, which are important for understanding detailed climate dynamics.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用月度和年度气候数据进行详细气候应用的潜在局限性包括缺乏分析特定气候现象所需的分辨率，例如极端天气事件频率的变化、生长季节的长度和热浪持续时间。日数据提供了更精细的时间分辨率，这对于这些类型的分析至关重要，而这些分析对于理解详细的气候动态是非常重要的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the challenges in acquiring daily climate data necessary for comprehensive climate change analysis?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 获取全面气候变化分析所需的日常气候数据所面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Daily climate data are less accessible than monthly values due to impediments such as mandates for cost recovery in many countries, which hampers climate change analysis and model comparison studies.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 每日气候数据的获取比月度数据更为困难，原因包括许多国家对成本回收的要求，这妨碍了气候变化分析和模型比较研究。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do historical daily meteorological observations often face a variety of measurement, recording, and processing problems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么历史上的每日气象观测经常面临各种测量、记录和处理问题？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The diversity of data from over 40,000 land-based stations, some dating back to the mid-1800s, results in a large variety of measurement, recording, digitization, transmission, and processing problems, requiring critical QA procedures to ensure data quality.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 来自超过40,000个陆地气象站的数据多样性，其中一些数据可以追溯到19世纪中叶，导致在测量、记录、数字化、传输和处理过程中出现各种问题，因此需要严格的质量保证程序以确保数据质量。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the spatial coverage inconsistencies in the meteorological data collected from different stations?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 不同气象站收集的气象数据在空间覆盖上的不一致性受哪些因素影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Spatial coverage inconsistency arises from changes in observation time, station location, and types of thermometers used, leading to many inhomogeneities in the records.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 空间覆盖不一致是由于观测时间、站点位置和使用的温度计类型的变化所导致的，这导致记录中出现许多不均匀性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using a semiautomatic method for identifying large jumps and erratic behavior in meteorological data series?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用半自动方法识别气象数据系列中的大幅跳跃和异常行为的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a semiautomatic method for identifying large jumps and erratic behavior in meteorological data series allows for the detection of gross shifts in precipitation time series, enhancing the reliability of the data. However, it may become impractical for very large datasets which require regular reprocessing, necessitating a fully automated system for efficiency and accuracy.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用半自动方法识别气象数据系列中的大幅跳跃和异常行为，可以有效检测降水时间序列中的明显变化，从而提高数据的可靠性。然而，对于需要定期重新处理的非常大数据集，这种方法可能变得不切实际，因此需要一个完全自动化的系统以提高效率和准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the absence of a formal mechanism for sharing daily climate data via the Global Telecommunication System (GTS) affect the availability and quality of global climate datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 缺乏通过全球电信系统（GTS）共享每日气候数据的正式机制如何影响全球气候数据集的可用性和质量？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The absence of a formal mechanism for sharing daily climate data via the GTS results in inconsistent transmission of daily summaries, leading to a lack of comprehensive daily climate reports from national surface networks. This affects the availability and quality of global climate datasets, hindering detailed climate change analysis and model comparison studies.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 缺乏通过全球电信系统（GTS）共享每日气候数据的正式机制，导致每日摘要的传输不一致，从而影响国家地面网络的全面每日气候报告的生成。这影响了全球气候数据集的可用性和质量，妨碍了详细的气候变化分析和模型比较研究。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to implement automated quality assurance procedures for daily meteorological observations in large-scale datasets?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在大规模数据集中实施自动化质量保证程序对于日常气象观测的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Automated quality assurance procedures are crucial for detecting a variety of data errors efficiently and regularly, given the vast size of datasets like GHCN-Daily, which must be reprocessed to incorporate additional historical and real-time data while maintaining a low false-positive rate.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 自动化质量保证程序对于高效且定期地检测各种数据错误至关重要，考虑到像GHCN-Daily这样的大型数据集必须重新处理以纳入额外的历史和实时数据，同时保持较低的误报率。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intentions behind creating a global database for daily climate data, especially in terms of addressing challenges in climate change analysis?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 创建全球日常气候数据数据库的意图是什么，特别是在应对气候变化分析中的挑战方面？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intention is to address the lack of accessible daily data, which is essential for analyzing multidecadal climate trends and variability, and to overcome impediments such as mandates for cost recovery that limit the release of daily climate data for public use.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目的是解决缺乏可获取的日常数据的问题，这对于分析多年代际气候趋势和变异性至关重要，并克服诸如成本回收的要求等障碍，这些障碍限制了日常气候数据的公开发布。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in ensuring the quality and accuracy of meteorological data collected from global land-based stations?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保从全球陆地气象站收集的气象数据质量和准确性所涉及的程序有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To ensure the quality and accuracy of meteorological data from global land-based stations, a comprehensive set of fully automated quality assurance (QA) procedures is applied. These procedures involve 19 carefully evaluated tests that detect duplicate data, climatological outliers, and various inconsistencies (internal, temporal, and spatial). The tests are arranged in a sequence to enhance the performance of later checks by utilizing the error detection capabilities of earlier ones. The QA system aims to minimize the false-positive rate for flagged values, achieved through manual review of random samples and setting appropriate thresholds.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了确保全球陆地气象站气象数据的质量和准确性，应用了一套全面的全自动质量保证（QA）程序。这些程序涉及19项经过仔细评估的测试，旨在检测重复数据、气候异常值以及各种不一致性（内部、一致性和空间）。这些测试按顺序排列，以利用早期测试的错误检测能力来增强后续检查的性能。QA系统旨在最小化标记值的假阳性率，通过对随机样本进行人工审查和设定适当的阈值来实现。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can researchers address the challenge of spatial coverage unevenness in climatological datasets?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 研究人员如何应对气候数据集空间覆盖不均的问题？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Researchers can address the challenge of spatial coverage unevenness by employing checks on station coordinates and elevation using datasets like the Global One-Kilometer Base Elevation (GLOBE) dataset. Additionally, comparisons are made between long-term monthly station averages and independently constructed gridded datasets of monthly values to identify incorrect coordinate data and ensure consistency. Implementing a semiautomatic method for detecting large jumps and erratic behavior in time series can also help address this issue.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 研究人员可以通过使用全球一公里基础海拔（GLOBE）数据集对站点坐标和海拔进行检查，以应对空间覆盖不均的问题。此外，还可以将长期月度站点平均值与独立构建的月度值网格数据集进行比较，以识别不正确的坐标数据并确保一致性。实施一种半自动化的方法来检测时间序列中的大幅跳跃和异常行为也可以帮助解决这个问题。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have facilitated the global collection and regular updating of daily meteorological observations?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步促进了全球气象观测的日常收集和定期更新？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological advances, such as improved data sharing mechanisms and computational resources, along with a greater willingness of countries to share daily observations, have facilitated the collection and regular updating of a global dataset of historical daily meteorological observations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术进步，例如改进的数据共享机制和计算资源，以及各国更愿意分享每日观测数据，促进了全球历史每日气象观测数据集的收集和定期更新。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might daily climate data be less accessible than monthly data in the context of global climate studies?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在全球气候研究的背景下，日常气候数据可能比月度数据更难获取的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Daily data are comparatively less accessible than monthly values due to impediments such as mandates for cost recovery in many countries, which limit the release of daily climate data for widespread public use. This scarcity of daily data hampers climate change analysis and model comparison studies.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 每日数据相比于月度数据更难获取，这主要是由于许多国家的成本回收要求，限制了每日气候数据的广泛公开发布。这种每日数据的稀缺性妨碍了气候变化分析和模型比较研究。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise when designing a quality assurance system for a large climate dataset, and how can they be addressed?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在为大型气候数据集设计质量保证系统时，可能会出现哪些挑战，以及如何解决这些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Designing a QA system for large datasets involves challenges such as effectively detecting a variety of data errors without manual intervention and maintaining a low false-positive rate. One approach is to use a comprehensive set of fully automated QA procedures, which includes arranging tests in a deliberate sequence to enhance performance and setting thresholds based on manual reviews to minimize false positives.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 设计大型数据集的质量保证系统面临着诸多挑战，例如有效检测各种数据错误而无需人工干预，并保持较低的误报率。一种方法是使用一套全面的全自动质量保证程序，包括以有意的顺序安排测试以提高性能，并根据人工审核设置阈值以最小化误报。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be inconsistencies in daily climate data even with systematic quality checks?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 即使进行了系统的质量检查，为什么每日气候数据可能会存在不一致性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inconsistencies may arise because electronic data files often lack indications of whether reported values are due to snow, hail, or other forms of frozen precipitation. This makes it difficult to distinguish between actual reports and erroneous nonzero values in the SNOW and SNWD fields, posing a challenge for both data users and QA procedures.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 不一致可能会出现，因为电子数据文件通常缺乏指示报告值是否由于雪、冰雹或其他形式的冻 precipitation。这使得区分实际报告和 SNOW 和 SNWD 字段中的错误非零值变得困难，这对数据用户和质量保证程序都构成了挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effectively do current data collection methods address the challenges of gathering daily climate data over global land areas?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集方法在多大程度上有效应对了在全球陆地区域收集每日气候数据的挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Current data collection methods for daily climate data over global land areas face several challenges, including a lack of central repositories for daily reports and optional transmission of daily summaries in many cases. Although the Global Historical Climatology Network (GHCN)-Daily dataset attempts to address these needs by collecting data from over 80,000 stations in 180 countries, the relative inaccessibility of daily data compared to monthly values still hampers comprehensive climate change analysis.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前全球陆地区域每日气候数据的收集方法面临着一些挑战，包括缺乏集中存储每日报告的仓库，以及在许多情况下每日摘要的可选传输。尽管全球历史气候网络（GHCN）-每日数据集试图通过收集来自180个国家的超过80,000个气象站的数据来解决这些需求，但每日数据相较于月度数据的相对不可获取性仍然妨碍了全面的气候变化分析。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways can the quality assurance procedures for daily meteorological observations be improved to enhance data reliability?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何改进日常气象观测的质量保证程序，以提高数据的可靠性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Quality assurance procedures for daily meteorological observations can be improved by developing more effective automated systems with low false-positive rates. The current GHCN-Daily QA system uses a set of 19 tests that detect various inconsistencies, but manual review and setting appropriate thresholds are critical to minimizing false positives. Enhancing these procedures could involve refining error detection algorithms and incorporating additional checks for distinguishing between different forms of precipitation.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 日常气象观测的质量保证程序可以通过开发更有效的自动化系统来改善，以降低误报率。目前的全球历史气候网络-日常（GHCN-Daily）质量保证系统使用一套19项测试来检测各种不一致性，但手动审核和设定适当的阈值对于最小化误报至关重要。增强这些程序可以涉及改进错误检测算法，并纳入额外的检查，以区分不同形式的降水。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the procedures employed to ensure data quality and accuracy in large-scale climatology datasets.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对确保大规模气候学数据集的数据质量和准确性所采用的程序感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Quality assurance procedures applied to large-scale climatology datasets like GHCN-Daily include a comprehensive set of fully automated tests that detect duplicate data, climatological outliers, and inconsistencies. These procedures consist of 19 carefully evaluated tests that minimize the false-positive rate and ensure high-quality historical and real-time daily data by arranging tests in a deliberate sequence to enhance error detection capabilities.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 应用于大规模气候学数据集如GHCN-Daily的质量保证程序包括一套全面的全自动测试，能够检测重复数据、气候异常值和不一致性。这些程序由19项经过仔细评估的测试组成，旨在最小化假阳性率，并通过有序安排测试的顺序来增强错误检测能力，从而确保高质量的历史和实时日常数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of why daily climate data are less accessible than monthly values despite their importance for certain climate applications.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解为什么每日气候数据的可获取性低于每月数据，尽管它们对某些气候应用的重要性更大。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Daily climate data are less accessible than monthly values due to various impediments, such as mandates for cost recovery in many countries, which limit the release of daily climate data for public use. This lack of accessibility hampers climate change analysis and model comparison studies, despite the necessity of daily resolution data for analyzing changes in the growing season length, heavy precipitation frequency, and heat wave duration.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 每日气候数据的获取比月度数据更为困难，原因包括许多国家对成本回收的要求，这限制了每日气候数据的公开发布。这种缺乏可获取性妨碍了气候变化分析和模型比较研究，尽管分析生长季节长度、强降水频率和热浪持续时间的变化需要每日分辨率的数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the techniques used to ensure data quality and accuracy in daily climate datasets across global land areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析确保全球陆地区域每日气候数据集数据质量和准确性所使用的技术。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The Global Historical Climatology Network (GHCN)-Daily dataset applies a comprehensive set of fully automated quality assurance procedures to ensure data accuracy. These include 19 tests to detect duplicate data, climatological outliers, and inconsistencies, arranged in a sequence to enhance performance, with manual reviews of flagged values to set thresholds and minimize false positives.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 全球历史气候网络（GHCN）日常数据集应用了一套全面的全自动质量保证程序，以确保数据的准确性。这些程序包括19项测试，用于检测重复数据、气候异常值和不一致性，按照顺序排列以提高性能，并对标记的值进行人工审核，以设定阈值并最小化假阳性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential methodologies for expanding the spatial coverage of meteorological datasets while maintaining data integrity.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请确定在保持数据完整性的同时扩展气象数据集空间覆盖范围的潜在方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Expanding the spatial coverage involves addressing the uneven spatial distribution of meteorological stations, which can be achieved by integrating independent datasets like GLOBE for station elevation comparisons and employing the standard normal homogeneity test for detecting shifts in precipitation time series, thereby ensuring data integrity across expanded areas.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 扩展空间覆盖涉及解决气象站的不均匀空间分布，这可以通过整合独立数据集如GLOBE进行站点海拔比较，以及采用标准正态同质性检验来检测降水时间序列的变化，从而确保在扩展区域内数据的完整性。
